params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a category by the specified ID.
description:
The `getCategory()` function returns a promise that resolves to a category whose ID matches the given ID.

>**Note:** Unless specified in the `options` parameter, the following fields are not included in the response object: `INTERNAL_ID` and `URL`.

params.name: slug
params.doc:
Slug of the category to retrieve.

The end of a category's URL. For example, `'https:/example.com/blog/category/{my-category-slug}'`. Case sensitive and generally based on the category `label` if not specified.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options specifying which fields to return.

docs.summary: Gets a category by the specified slug.
description:
The `getCategoryBySlug()` function returns a promise that resolves to a category whose slug matches the given slug.

The `slug` is the end of a category's URL that refers to a specific category. For example, if a category's URL is `'https://example.com/blog/category/{my-category-slug}'`, the slug is `'my-post-slug'`. The slug is case-sensitive string that is generally derived from the category's `label`, unless specified otherwise.

>**Note:** Unless specified in the `options` parameter, the following fields are not included in the response object: `INTERNAL_ID` and `URL`.

The `listCategories()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 categories in order of their `rank` starting with `'0'`. The `rank` is the position in which the categories are displayed in the categories menu page. By default, categories get added to the bottom of the menu page.

members.name: cursor

members.doc: Number of items to return. If not set, defaults to 50.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.doc: For how many items the requested action was not successful

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: For how many items the requested action was successful

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: total number of failures without details because detailed-failure-threshold exceeded

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

paging

members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tags information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc: Whether the auto creation of 301 redirects on slug changes is disabled.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc:
Sort order.
One of:
ASC,
DESC

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `'inner content'` in `<title> inner content </title>`

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the SEO tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the SEO tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc: The props property holds an object of `{"key": "value"}` pairs where the key is one of the SEO tag's properties (name, content, rel, href, etc.) and the value is the value for that property. `{"name": "description", "content": "The description itself."}`.

members.name: type
members.doc: SEO tag type. Supported values: `'title'`, `'meta'`, `'script'`, `'link'`.
